com.golden.gamedev.engine.jogl
Class JOGLFullScreenMode

java.lang.Object
  com.golden.gamedev.engine.jogl.JOGLFullScreenMode
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.golden.gamedev.engine.BaseGraphics, java.util.Comparator
public class JOGLFullScreenMode
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.golden.gamedev.engine.BaseGraphics, java.util.Comparator

Graphics engine for OpenGL JOGL Full Screen Exclusive Environment (FSEM),
JOGL is available to download at https://jogl.dev.java.net/.

Make sure the downloaded library is included into your game classpath before using this graphics engine.

Note: GTGE is not associated in any way with JOGL, this class is only interfacing JOGL to be used in GTGE.
This class is created and has been tested to be working properly using JOGL v1.1b-08.

Use OpenGLGameLoader to load the game in OpenGL JOGL graphics engine environment.

See Also:
OpenGLGameLoader, JOGL official site

compare

public int compare(java.lang.Object o1,
                   java.lang.Object o2)
Sorts display mode, display mode in the first stack will be used by the game. The o1 and o2 are instance of java.awt.DisplayMode.

In this comparator, the first stack (the one that the game will use) would be display mode that has the biggest bits per pixel (bpp) and has the biggest but limited to 75Hz frequency (refresh rate).

Specified by:
compare in interface java.util.Comparator
